channel.title: math.GM updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GM updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: On the Number of Ways a Natural Number Can Be Written in the Form $7a^2 + b^2$
item.description: arXiv:2408.01763v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We manipulate the methods of $q$-series to arrive at a number of results and tackle with the Diophantine equation $n = 7a^2+b^2$, originally studied by Euler. It is demonstrated that, by utilising the methods of $q$-series, we are able to arrive at the formula which gives us the number of solutions of the Diophantine equation $n = 7a^2+b^2$ for a given natural number $n$.
item.dc:creator: Aung Phone Maw
